physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient alert and oriented only to self; severe naming difficulties; finger agnosia; dyscalculia; right-left disorientation; poor performance on go no-go tasks; motor apraxia; perseveration; anxious and fearful with no delusions or hallucinations; neurologic examination normal except for noted deficits.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial SPECT imaging showed left cerebral hemisphere relative hypoperfusion; a follow-up SPECT imaging after treatment showed significant improvement with normalization of relative perfusion.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: SPECT imaging on day 3 showed relative hypoperfusion throughout the left cerebral hemisphere.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial hypoperfusion correlated with clinical findings suggesting HE; follow-up imaging a month later showed normalization.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Carotid Doppler examination revealed a 27% decrease in flow rate due to stenosis in the region of the left carotid bifurcation.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood ammonia 295 g/dL on initial testing; decreased to 135 g/dL after treatment with lactulose.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Decline in serum ammonia levels after treatment correlated with normalization of mental status and speech abnormalities.
